cve_records.title: Privilege Escalation in PostgreSQL
cve_records.text:
A privilege escalation vulnerability in PostgreSQL allows local users to gain elevated privileges on the system.

Remediation: Disable vulnerable features in PostgreSQL until patches are available.

cve_records.title: Information Disclosure in WordPress
cve_records.text:
An information disclosure vulnerability in WordPress may allow unauthorized access to sensitive system information.

Remediation: Apply security patch WordPress for 1.5.5 to mitigate the risk.

cve_records.title: Denial of Service in Firefox
cve_records.text:
A denial of service vulnerability in Firefox could allow attackers to cause the service to become unavailable.

Remediation: Implement access controls and network segmentation for Firefox.

cve_records.title: Remote Code Execution in MySQL
cve_records.text:
A remote code execution vulnerability in MySQL could allow attackers to run arbitrary commands on the target system.

Remediation: Configure MySQL with proper input validation and sanitization.

cve_records.title: CSRF in PostgreSQL
cve_records.text:
A cross-site request forgery vulnerability in PostgreSQL allows attackers to perform unauthorized actions on behalf of authenticated users.

Remediation: Implement access controls and network segmentation for PostgreSQL.

cve_records.title: CSRF in Apache HTTP Server
cve_records.text:
A cross-site request forgery vulnerability in Apache HTTP Server allows attackers to perform unauthorized actions on behalf of authenticated users.

Remediation: Disable vulnerable features in Apache HTTP Server until patches are available.

cve_records.title: Denial of Service in Chrome
cve_records.text:
A denial of service vulnerability in Chrome could allow attackers to cause the service to become unavailable.

Remediation: Update Chrome to version 1.5.4 or later to address this vulnerability.

cve_records.title: SQL Injection in Microsoft Exchange
cve_records.text:
A SQL injection vulnerability in Microsoft Exchange allows attackers to manipulate database queries through unsanitized input parameters.

Remediation: Disable vulnerable features in Microsoft Exchange until patches are available.

cve_records.title: SQL Injection in Docker
cve_records.text:
A SQL injection vulnerability in Docker allows attackers to manipulate database queries through unsanitized input parameters.

Remediation: Configure Docker with proper input validation and sanitization.

cve_records.title: Insecure Deserialization in PHP
cve_records.text:
An insecure deserialization vulnerability in PHP could lead to remote code execution through malicious serialized objects.

Remediation: Disable vulnerable features in PHP until patches are available.

cve_records.title: Authentication Bypass in Microsoft Exchange
cve_records.text:
An authentication bypass vulnerability in Microsoft Exchange allows attackers to circumvent security controls.

Remediation: Update Microsoft Exchange to version 3.2.5 or later to address this vulnerability.

cve_records.title: SQL Injection in OpenSSL
cve_records.text:
A SQL injection vulnerability in OpenSSL allows attackers to manipulate database queries through unsanitized input parameters.

Remediation: Configure OpenSSL with proper input validation and sanitization.

Remediation: Configure Node.js with proper input validation and sanitization.

cve_records.title: CSRF in Python
cve_records.text:
A cross-site request forgery vulnerability in Python allows attackers to perform unauthorized actions on behalf of authenticated users.

Remediation: Disable vulnerable features in Python until patches are available.

cve_records.title: Denial of Service in Windows
cve_records.text:
A denial of service vulnerability in Windows could allow attackers to cause the service to become unavailable.

Remediation: Configure Windows with proper input validation and sanitization.

cve_records.title: Directory Traversal in Linux Kernel
cve_records.text:
A directory traversal vulnerability in Linux Kernel allows attackers to access files outside the intended directory.

Remediation: Disable vulnerable features in Linux Kernel until patches are available.

cve_records.title: Remote Code Execution in PHP
cve_records.text:
A remote code execution vulnerability in PHP could allow attackers to run arbitrary commands on the target system.

Remediation: Disable vulnerable features in PHP until patches are available.

cve_records.title: Authentication Bypass in OpenSSL
cve_records.text:
An authentication bypass vulnerability in OpenSSL allows attackers to circumvent security controls.

Remediation: Update OpenSSL to version 2.2.9 or later to address this vulnerability.

cve_records.title: Directory Traversal in Firefox

cve_records.title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) in Samba
cve_records.text:
A cross-site scripting vulnerability in Samba allows attackers to inject malicious scripts into web pages viewed by users.

Remediation: Disable vulnerable features in Samba until patches are available.
